properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 9 at 3:06PM EST by NWS Wilmington OH
properties.description:
Moderate snow will spread into areas from Celina to Kenton late
this afternoon and continue into early evening before changing to
rain. Some locally heavy bursts of snow will be possible, with
visibility falling below a mile. Accumulations will mainly be
limited to grassy and elevated surfaces, and could range from 1 to
2 inches before the changeover occurs early this evening. The
greatest chance of the higher accumulations will be along and
north of a Celina to Kenton line. Here, an isolated 3 inch amount
is possible.

Roads should remain just wet through the afternoon, but with the
onset of darkness, some slippery spots may develop across the area
and linger for an hour or two even after the snow changes to rain.
Use caution of traveling across the area later this afternoon
and through the early evening.

NWSheadline: Accumulating Snow Late This Afternoon into Early Evening
